glsa.title: libsndfile: Buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow vulnerability has been discovered in libsndfile.

background.p: libsndfile is a library for reading and writing various formats of audio files including WAV and FLAC.

description.p: Robert Buchholz of the Gentoo Security team discovered that the flac_buffer_copy() function does not correctly handle FLAC streams with variable block sizes which leads to a heap-based buffer overflow (CVE-2007-4974).

impact.p: A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by enticing a user to open a specially crafted FLAC file or network stream with an application using libsndfile. This might lead to the execution of arbitrary code with privileges of the user playing the file.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
